result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse James Jackson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jesse James Jackson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Eugene E. Detert appeared by video for Jesse James Jackson.  Prosecuting attorney Claire E Zyber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for defense motion to modify bail.  Arguments heard.  Court denied defense request to modify bail.  Case is adjourned to 11-8-22 at 1:30 pm for status conference by zoom.
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court is in trial and unable to hear this case.  Court will reschedule case back to Br. 10, Judge Havas.
Bail/bond hearing on October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 10:
Defendant Jesse James Jackson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Eugene E. Detert appeared by video for Jesse James Jackson.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court took judicial notice of 2000CF3123 and  2000CF4639. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer Binter. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Defense to be heard on bail on the next date.

Defendant Jesse James Jackson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court for Jesse James Jackson.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a State V. Lee hearing.  Attorney Detert is now the attorney of record. Case is adjourned to 9-29-22 at 1:30 pm for Preliminary Hearing Court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report, filed.

Defendant Jesse James Jackson not in court, in custody in HOC.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Appointment Status Letter

Defendant Jesse James Jackson not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminray hearing. States witness is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with RML (DOB 5/7/65); WMD (DOB 9/1/50) 
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jesse James Jackson in court with attorney Robert W Peterson.  Defendant Jesse James Jackson in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jesse James Jackson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  AS TO COUNT 2:  Motion to dismiss by defense for lack of probable cause argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned to Br. PE for Branch 10.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
